bio:treatment.description: Branches densely whorled; lower nodes with 15-30+ branches, some sterile, bearing highly reduced or no spikelets.
bio:treatment.discussion: Piptatherum miliaceum subsp. thomasii has a native range similar to that of subsp. miliaceum, except that it does not grow in semidesert regions. In the Flora region, it is known only from cultivated specimens.
